response.description: Restpack Screenshot API allows you to capture pixel-perfect screenshots or thumbnails of any website. It functions via an easy-to-use RESTful web service that can capture live web page views and deliver results in several formats. This API leverages a browser rendering engine capable of dealing with modern HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, ensuring that the captured screenshots are accurate representations of the live web pages.

features.full_page: Option to capture the whole web page length.
features.javascript_delay: Delay in milliseconds to wait for JavaScript execution before taking the screenshot.
features.user_agent: Custom user agent string for the captures.
features.headers: Set custom HTTP headers, including cookies.
features.css: Apply custom CSS to the page before capturing.
features.delay: Wait for a specified amount of time before taking the screenshot.

examples.simple_capture: Send a GET request with the target URL as a query parameter to capture a screenshot immediately.
examples.full_page_capture: Send a GET or POST request with customized parameters to capture a full-length screenshot of the web page, including additional settings like viewport dimensions, delay, and custom headers or CSS.

usage.limitations: The functionality is based on a browser engine, hence some extremely JavaScript-heavy sites or those that use technologies like WebGL might not render perfectly.
